title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer to practice at second and third base during Red Sox spring training in Fort Myers, Fla.
Boston Red Sox manager Alex Cora plans to finalize the starting infield positions, emphasizing defensive improvement.
Romy Gonzalez, Nick Sogard, and Isiah Kiner-Falefa also compete for second and third base spots during the preseason.

title: Report: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay in New England, won’t take OC interviews
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Ashton Grant will remain as Patriots QBs coach, opting out of OC interviews with other NFL teams.
Grant played a significant role in QB Drake Maye's development and will continue under head coach Mike Vrabel.
Grant previously coached at Holy Cross and the Browns before joining the Patriots in February 2025.

title: Brighton community raises $25k for flooded barbershop
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Brighton's Matt's Barber Shop faced severe flooding after a burst pipe caused extensive water damage on February 10, 2026.
Longtime customer Dietrich Warner initiated a GoFundMe campaign, raising over $25,800 to aid in the shop's recovery.
The barbershop, a key community space, plans to rebuild quickly, with community support driving the restoration efforts.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Apple TV's 'Eternity' features Elizabeth Olsen choosing between two deceased husbands in a fantastical romcom setting.
'Harold & Maude' and 'When Harry Met Sally' are classic romcoms streaming on Pluto TV and Hulu, respectively.
James Van Der Beek's 'Dawson's Creek' and 'Love Is Blind' Season 10 now available on Netflix.

title: Court says Mass. father’s battle over LGBTQ-friendly lessons excludes books on gender stereotypes
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A federal judge ruled Lexington educators aren't required to allow a father to opt his child out of lessons on gender stereotypes.
The father's lawsuit against Lexington's school district focuses on issues of marriage, gender, and sexuality, not gender stereotypes.
The court referenced the father's right to direct his child's education, but didn't include books on gender stereotypes in the injunction.

title: Roman Anthony set to join Team USA for World Baseball Classic if he passes physical
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony set to join Team USA for World Baseball Classic, pending a physical after replacing Corbin Carroll.
Anthony, 21, would be Team USA's youngest player and hasn't had a physical since a 2025 oblique injury.
Team USA's outfield features Aaron Judge, Byron Buxton, and Pete Crow-Armstrong; Anthony's batting may secure playing time.

title: $20M penthouse at Taylor Swift’s rumored wedding venue hits market
author: Regina Cole
bullets: The Ocean House penthouse in Westerly, Rhode Island, is listed for $20 million.
This 4,696 square-foot unit includes 3 bedrooms, 4 bathrooms, and a 2,400 square-foot terrace.
The luxury property offers hotel amenities like a private beach, pool, and dining options.

title: 10 Celtics stats that should show encouragement and discouragement entering All-Star break
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics hold second place in Eastern Conference with a 35-19 record ahead of the All-Star break.
Jaylen Brown averages 29.3 points per game, contributing to the Celtics' strong performance this season.
Celtics are 12-14 in clutch games, the worst record among current playoff teams in close matches.

title: Your Cape Cod winter guide: 20 things to do during the cold months
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Cape Cod offers winter activities like glass blowing at Sandwich Glass Museum and the Hyannis Kennedy Legacy Trail.
Outdoor options include the Cape Cod Rail Trail, Nauset Beach, and cross-country skiing at Nickerson State Park.
Visitors can enjoy dining at Bamboo Chinese Cuisine, Devil's Purse Brewing Company, and UVA Wine Bar in Cape Cod.

title: She’s running Boston for people like her with Type 1 Diabetes
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Kristine Lapczynski, a pharmacist from Fuquay-Varina, NC, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon to support Breakthrough T1D.
Lapczynski aims to raise awareness for Type 1 Diabetes, a condition she has managed for 23 years.
She hopes to inspire her daughter and others with Type 1 Diabetes by participating in the marathon.
